message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. I believe it has tremendous value for your business and I'm confident it will be a great investment. My initial offer is $1,300,000. This reflects the unique benefits and potential of the product. What do you think?

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you see in the product. After careful consideration, I would like to propose a counteroffer of $1,200,000. I hope this aligns better with my budget.

Bob, I understand your perspective and appreciate your counteroffer. While I value our potential partnership, I'm still firm on a price closer to my initial offer. I'm willing to come down to $1,250,000 to meet your needs. This price still represents significant value for you and allows us to move forward with the sale. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your willingness to adjust your offer, Alice. Considering my budget constraints, I would like to propose a counteroffer of $1,225,000. I hope this proposal will be acceptable to you.

Bob, while I appreciate your counteroffer, I'm still hoping we can find a price that works for both of us. I'm willing to compromise further and propose $1,240,000. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and allows us to reach an agreement.  Let's keep working towards a solution.

Thank you for your continued flexibility, Alice. After considering your latest offer, I would like to propose a counteroffer of $1,235,000. I hope this aligns more closely with your expectations while still respecting my financial constraints.
Bob, we're getting close!  I'm willing to go down to $1,237,500.  This is a very fair price considering the value this product will bring to your business.  I really hope we can finalize this deal.

Alice, thank you for your willingness to negotiate. I appreciate your efforts to find a mutually beneficial price. Based on my calculations and considerations, I would like to propose a counteroffer of $1,232,500. I hope this figure will allow us to conclude the transaction.
